net.ant.rc.serial.arduino2wd

Class Arduino2WDSerialDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.ant.rc.serial.SerialDriver
      • net.ant.rc.serial.arduino2wd.Arduino2WDSerialDriver

  • public class Arduino2WDSerialDriver
extends SerialDriver
    SerialDriver extension for Arduino-based 2WD wheel robot. Used for translate commands from your application to your hardware (firmware logic). Modify it for your Robot Firmware.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ant
    See Also:
    Don't forget to modify Arduino2WDEachWheelCommand for your hardware too.

    • Method Detail

      • sendVectorCommand

        public java.lang.String sendVectorCommand(int x,
                                 int y)
                                   throws CommPortException
        Description copied from class: SerialDriver
        Sends Vector-style command to hardware. Parameters x,y - is shift vector of single joystick. To use 2 joysticks see sendTractorCommand method
        Specified by:
        sendVectorCommand in class SerialDriver
        Parameters:
        x - X joystick shift
        y - Y joystick shift
        Returns:
        Firmware answer text
        Throws:
        CommPortException
        See Also:
        VectorCommand

      • sendTractorCommand

        public java.lang.String sendTractorCommand(int left,
                                  int right)
                                    throws CommPortException
        Description copied from class: SerialDriver
        Sends Tractor-style command to hardware.
        Specified by:
        sendTractorCommand in class SerialDriver
        Parameters:
        left - Left joystick speed (Positive values means straight direction. Negatives - forward.)
        right - Right joystick speed
        Returns:
        Firmware answer text
        Throws:
        CommPortException
        See Also:
        TractorCommand

      • sendEachWheelCommand

        public java.lang.String sendEachWheelCommand(EachWheelCommand eachWheelCommand)
                                      throws CommPortException
        Description copied from class: SerialDriver
        Method for constructing programmatic (not analog like WebRC) moves. This method isn't currently used in any example. But it gives direct access to hardware motors for your application without translation by SerialDriver.
        Specified by:
        sendEachWheelCommand in class SerialDriver
        Parameters:
        eachWheelCommand - Defines speeds for each motor of your device
        Returns:
        Firmware answer text
        Throws:
        CommPortException
